Scheduler::Scheduler (   ) 
 

Constructor. Initialize list of ready threads.

Constructor. Initialize the list of ready but not running threads to empty.

Destructor. De-allocate the ready list.

Destructor. De-allocate the list of ready threads.

Member Function Documentation

Thread * Scheduler::FindNextToRun (   )  [virtual]
 

Dequeue first thread of the ready list, if any, and return thread.

Return the next thread to be scheduled onto the CPU. If there are no ready threads, return NULL. Side effect: Thread is removed from the ready list.

Returns:
Thread to be scheduled on the CPU

Reimplemented in FixedPriorityScheduler.

void Scheduler::Print (   ) 
 

Print contents of ready list.

Print the scheduler state -- in other words, the contents of the ready list. For debugging.

void Scheduler::ReadyToRun (  Thread *  thread  )  [virtual]
 

Inserts a thread in the ready list.

Mark a thread as ready, but not running. Put it on the ready list, for later scheduling onto the CPU.

Parameters:
thread is the thread to be put on the ready list.

Reimplemented in FixedPriorityScheduler.

void Scheduler::SwitchTo (  Thread *  nextThread  ) 
 

Cause context switch to nextThread.

Dispatch the CPU to nextThread. Save the state of the old thread, and load the state of the new thread, by calling the machine dependent context switch routine, SWITCH.

Note: we assume the state of the previously running thread has already been changed from running to blocked or ready (depending). Side effect: The global variable currentThread becomes nextThread.

Parameters:
nextThread is the thread to be put into the CPU.

Member Data Documentation

Listint* Scheduler::readyList [protected]
 

Queue of threads that are ready to run,but not running.
